Description: Fragment of black figure pottery situla (?); straight sided slightly flaring ring foot and part of lower body; reconstructed from two joining sherds. Streaky, red/brown slip on outside; surface slightly worn. Hard, fine, light yellow/orange clay; Munsell 7.5YR 8/4 (pink).
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18
Curator's comments: Findspot number 'Chamber 18' scratched twice by Petrie
Bibliographic references: Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 332)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.210)
Acquisition notes: Found unregistered in the Department in 2010, in a box with other sherds from Tell Dafana.
